description.en: The course gives a general introduction to the fields of law which are relevant in international business, including contract law, international dispute resolution, European Union competition law, intellectual property law and company law. The teaching and learning methods that are used are interactive lectures, seminars and independent learning, including independent reading and written homeworks.
description.et: Kursus annab üldise sissejuhatuse rahvusvahelise äritegevuse jaoks olulisematesse õiguse valdkondadesse, sealhulgas lepinguõigus, rahvusvaheline vaidluste lahendamine, Euroopa Liidu konkurentsiõigus, intellektuaalse omandi õigus ja ühinguõigus. Õppetöö toimub interaktiivsete loengute, seminaride ning iseseisva töö vormis, millest viimane hõlmab nii iseseisvat lugemist kui kirjalikke kodutöid.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to provide students of economics and other non-legal studies with a general overview of the fields of law which are relevant in international business, and to give them the basic knowledge and practical skills for solving the most common legal problems which arise in the course of international trade.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda majandustudengitele ning teiste mitte-õigusteaduse eriala tudengitele ülevaade rahvusvahelises äritegevuses olulisematest õiguse valdkondadest ning anda neile baasteadmised ja praktilised oskused, lahendamaks levinumaid rahvusvahelise kaubanduse käigus ette tulevaid õiguslikke probleeme.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course a student:
1) has a good general overview of the fields of law and the specific legal and practical issues which are relevant in international business and trade;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) omab head ülevaadet nendest õiguse valdkondadest ning konkreetsetest õiguslikest ja praktilistest küsimustest, mis on rahvusvahelises äris ja kaubanduses olulised;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) has basic knowledge about contract law, the different methods for resolving international disputes, European Union competition law, intellectual property law and company law;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) omab baasteadmisi lepinguõigusest, erinevatest rahvusvaheliste vaidluste lahendamise meetoditest, Euroopa Liidu konkurentsiõigusest, intellektuaalse omandi õigusest ning ühinguõigusest;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) can apply the acquired knowledge in practice by analysing and solving simple practical cases;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskab omandatud teadmisi praktikas rakendada, analüüsides ja lahendades lihtsamaid praktilisi kaasuseid;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) can propose practical and legally correct solutions to different legal problems which a company might face in the course of international business and trade;
learning_outcomes.et: 4) oskab välja pakkuda praktilisi ja õiguslikult korrektseid lahendusi erinevatele õiguslikele probleemidele, millega ettevõte võib rahvusvahelise äritegevuse ja kaubanduse käigus kokku puutuda;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) can provide critical analysis on the different topics discussed during the course.
learning_outcomes.et: 5) suudab teostada kursuse raames käsitletud teemadel kriitilist analüüsi.

independent_work.et:
1. Reading compulsory reading materials for the lectures/seminars.

2. Two homeworks (submitted via Moodle):
2.1.	Homework on contract law: solving contract law cases by applying the CISG.
Instructions: provided by the lecturer 
Grading: up to 30 points
 2.2.	Homework on all topics covered in the course: group work on advising a client in a complex practical case (submission of written work + presentation in seminar 2).
Instructions: provided by the lecturer
Grading: up to 30 points

3. Online test with open materials on all topics covered in the course (on Moodle)
Instructions: provided by the lecturer
Grading: up to 40 points

description.et:
2. Homework on all topics covered in the course (contract law, international dispute resolution, EU competition law, intellectual property law): advising a client in a complex legal situation/dispute; working in groups of 4-5; submitting written work and giving an oral presentation in a seminar. Specific instructions provided by the lecturer.
The work of a group is graded, all members of the group receive the same number of points, in total max 30 points.

Assessment criteria and relevance in determination of the final score:
- Correctness of formalisation and structure of the answer (5/30);
- Use of and reference to the correct legal provisions (5/30);
- Correctness (in case of practical situations, also the practicability and reasonableness) of the final answer (5/30)
- Sufficiency of explanation of the answer, level of legal analysis and establishing connections, correctness of interpretation of the relevant provisions (15/30). 
In the event that the criterion is achieved partially, 0,5 points can be given.
